info.name: SAP B1 v10 Service Layer v2 - Complete Collection
info.description:
Comprehensive SAP Business One v10 Service Layer API collection (OData v4).

âš ï¸ NAVIGATION PROPERTY ISSUES:
If you get errors like 'Cannot expand invalid navigation property', check Section 11.
Common fixes:
- DocumentLines â†’ Document_Lines
- ItemPrices â†’ PriceListLines
- BPAddresses â†’ BPFiscalTaxIDCollection

ðŸš€ QUICK START:
1. Set variables (username, password, companyDB)
2. Run Login (Section 1)
3. If navigation errors occur, run Section 11 discovery
4. Use SQL alternatives if needed

ðŸ“‹ INCLUDES:
- All standard entities (BP, Items, Documents, etc.)
- Financial operations
- Inventory management
- Services and actions
- Navigation property discovery
- SQL fallback queries

exec: // Auto-add session cookie to all requests except Login
console.log('âœ“ Logged in to company: ' + response.CompanyDB);

request.description: Login to SAP B1 v10. This creates a session and returns cookies needed for all subsequent requests.
Verify your session is working by getting company information
Returns all available entities in your SAP B1 v10 instance
Returns complete OData v4 metadata including all entities, properties, and relationships

If you're getting navigation property errors, try these common v10 patterns:

1. For Documents: Document_Lines (with underscore)
2. For Items: ItemWarehouseInfoCollection
3. For BusinessPartners: ContactEmployees

See Section 11 for full navigation discovery

url.raw: {{baseUrl}}/BusinessPartners?$filter=CardType eq 'cCustomer' and Valid eq 'tYES' and Frozen eq 'tNO'&$select=CardCode,CardName,CreditLimit,PayTermsGrpCode&$orderby=CardName&$top=50

query.value: CardType eq 'cCustomer' and Valid eq 'tYES' and Frozen eq 'tNO'

request.description: First, run this to see available navigation properties for BusinessPartners
NOTE: If this fails, try: BusinessPartner_Addresses, Addresses, or BPAddress (check metadata first)
Direct access to addresses collection - if this fails, check the navigation link in the BP response
Create minimal BP first. Add addresses separately if navigation property fails.

body.raw:
{
    "CardCode": "C99998",
    "CardName": "Test Customer Complete",
    "CardType": "cCustomer",
    "GroupCode": 100,
    "Phone1": "555-1234",
    "EmailAddress": "test@example.com",
    "ContactPerson": "John Doe",
    "Notes": "Created via API",
    "Valid": "tYES",
    "Frozen": "tNO",
    "ContactEmployees": [
        {
            "Name": "John Doe",
            "Position": "Manager",
            "Phone1": "555-1234",
            "E_Mail": "john@example.com",
            "Active": "tYES"
        }
    ]
}

request.description: Create with contact employees (usually works in v10)
Note: If 'ItemPrices' fails, try: PriceListLines or check section 11 for navigation discovery
Note: If 'DocumentLines' fails, try: Document_Lines, Lines, or OrderLines
Note: If 'DocumentLines' fails, try 'Document_Lines' (with underscore) or 'Lines'

body.raw:
--batch_request
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET BusinessPartners?$select=CardCode,CardName&$top=5 HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json

--batch_request
Content-Type: application/http
Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary

GET Items?$select=ItemCode,ItemName&$top=5 HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/json

--batch_request--

request.description:
Navigation properties like 'BPAddresses', 'ItemPrices', 'DocumentLines' may have different names in SAP B1 v10.

Common variations:
- DocumentLines â†’ Document_Lines, Lines, OrderLines
- ItemPrices â†’ PriceListLines, Prices
- BPAddresses â†’ BPFiscalTaxIDCollection, ContactEmployees

Run the discovery requests below to find your exact property names!
Look for properties ending with '@odata.navigationLink' in the response. These show the exact navigation property names.

Common navigation properties in v10:

BusinessPartners:
- ContactEmployees
- BPFiscalTaxIDCollection
- BPPaymentMethods
- BPBankAccounts
- BPWithholdingTaxCollection
- BPPaymentDates
- BPBranchAssignment
- BPAccountReceivablePaybleCollection

Items:
- ItemWarehouseInfoCollection
- ItemPrices
- ItemBarCodeCollection
- ItemPreferredVendors

Documents:
- DocumentLines
- DocumentAdditionalExpenses
- TaxExtension
- AddressExtension
- DocumentReferences
- DocumentPackages
Search for <EntityType Name="BusinessPartner"> in the XML response to see all NavigationProperty elements

If navigation properties don't work, use SQL joins:

OCRD = Business Partners
CRD1 = BP Addresses
OCPR = Contact Persons
CRD7 = BP Tax IDs
ORDR = Sales Orders
RDR1 = Order Lines
